verses.text: And Satan stood up against Israel , and provoked David to number Israel.
And David said to Joab and to the rulers of the people , Go , number Israel from Beer-sheba even to Dan ; and bring the number of them to me, that I may know \add it\add*.

And Joab answered , The \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* make his people an hundred times so many more as they \add be:\add* but, my lord the king , \add are\add* they not all my lord’s servants ? why then doth my lord require this thing? why will he be a cause of trespass to Israel ?
Nevertheless the king’s word prevailed against Joab. Wherefore Joab departed , and went throughout all Israel , and came to Jerusalem. \p

¶ And Joab gave the sum of the number of the people unto David. And all \add they of\add* Israel were a thousand thousand and an hundred thousand men that drew sword : and Judah \add was\add* four hundred threescore and ten thousand men that drew sword.
But Levi and Benjamin counted he not among them: for the king’s word was abominable to Joab. \p
And God was displeased with this thing ; therefore he smote Israel.\f + \fr 21.7 \ft And…: Heb. And it was evil in the eyes of the \+nd LORD\+nd* concerning this thing\f*
And David said unto God , I have sinned greatly , because I have done this thing : but now, I beseech thee, do away the iniquity of thy servant ; for I have done very foolishly. \p
¶ And the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* spake unto Gad , David’s seer , saying ,

Go and tell David , saying , Thus saith the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*, I offer thee three \add things:\add* choose thee one of them , that I may do \add it\add* unto thee.\f + \fr 21.10 \ft offer: Heb. stretch out\f*
So Gad came to David , and said unto him, Thus saith the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*, Choose thee\f + \fr 21.11 \ft Choose…: Heb. Take to thee\f*

Either three years’ famine ; or three months to be destroyed before thy foes , while that the sword of thine enemies overtaketh \add thee;\add* or else three days the sword of the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d*, even the pestilence , in the land , and the angel of the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d* destroying throughout all the coasts of Israel. Now therefore advise thyself what word I shall bring again to him that sent me.

And David said unto Gad , I am in a great strait : let me fall now into the hand of the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*; for very great \add are\add* his mercies : but let me not fall into the hand of man.\f + \fr 21.13 \ft very great: or, very many\f* \p
¶ So the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* sent pestilence upon Israel : and there fell of Israel seventy thousand men.

And God sent an angel unto Jerusalem to destroy it: and as he was destroying , the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d* beheld , and he repented him of the evil , and said to the angel that destroyed , It is enough , stay now thine hand. And the angel of the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d* stood by the threshingfloor of Ornan the Jebusite.  +  r 21.15  t Ornan: also called, Araunah *

And David lifted up his eyes , and saw the angel of the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* stand between the earth and the heaven , having a drawn sword in his hand stretched out over Jerusalem. Then David and the elders \add of Israel, who were\add* clothed in sackcloth , fell upon their faces.

And David said unto God , \add Is it\add* not I \add that\add* commanded the people to be numbered ? even I it is that have sinned and done evil indeed ; but \add as for\add* these sheep , what have they done ? let thine hand , I pray thee, O \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* my God , be on me, and on my father’s house ; but not on thy people , that they should be plagued. \p

¶ Then the angel of the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d* commanded Gad to say to David , that David should go up , and set up an altar unto the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d* in the threshingfloor of Ornan the Jebusite.
And David went up at the saying of Gad , which he spake in the name of the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*.

And Ornan turned back , and saw the angel ; and his four sons with him hid themselves. Now Ornan was threshing wheat.\f + \fr 21.20 \ft And Ornan…: or, When Ornan turned back and saw the angel, then he and his four sons with him hid themselves\f*
And as David came to Ornan , Ornan looked and saw David , and went out of the threshingfloor , and bowed himself to David with \add his\add* face to the ground.

Then David said to Ornan , Grant me the place of \add this\add* threshingfloor , that I may build an altar therein unto the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*: thou shalt grant it me for the full price : that the plague may be stayed from the people.\f + \fr 21.22 \ft Grant: Heb. Give\f*

And Ornan said unto David , Take \add it\add* to thee, and let my lord the king do \add that which is\add* good in his eyes : lo , I give \add thee\add* the oxen \add also\add* for burnt offerings , and the threshing instruments for wood , and the wheat for the meat offering ; I give it all.

And king David said to Ornan , Nay; but I will verily buy it for the full price : for I will not take \add that\add* which \add is\add* thine for the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*, nor offer burnt offerings without cost.
So David gave to Ornan for the place six hundred shekels of gold by weight.

And David built there an altar unto the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d*, and offered burnt offerings and peace offerings , and called upon the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d*; and he answered him from heaven by fire upon the altar of burnt offering.
And the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* commanded the angel ; and he put up his sword again into the sheath thereof. \p
¶ At that time when David saw that the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* had answered him in the threshingfloor of Ornan the Jebusite , then he sacrificed there.
For the tabernacle of the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*, which Moses made in the wilderness , and the altar of the burnt offering , \add were\add* at that season in the high place at Gibeon.
But David could not go before it to enquire of God : for he was afraid because of the sword of the angel of the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*.
